availableReserves().details: Matches Treasury.sol interface so DirectMint works unchanged

returns.allocations: Array of amounts allocated to each strategy

emergencyWithdrawAll().details: Loops over bounded, admin-controlled strategies array Emits StrategyWithdrawFailed on failures instead of silent catch

executeVaultChange().details: VAULT_ROLE controls deposit/withdraw, so changes must be timelocked

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

requestUpdateStrategy(address,uint256,ui.details: Prevents ALLOCATOR_ROLE from instantly redirecting funds to malicious strategy

requestUpgrade(address).details: Prevent overwriting a pending upgrade to block bait-and-switch attacks. Admin must cancelUpgrade() first before requesting a new one.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

totalBacking().details: Matches Treasury.sol interface so DirectMint works unchanged

totalValue().details: Loops over bounded, admin-controlled strategies array (max ~10 strategies) Uses try/catch so a reverting strategy doesn't DoS all deposits, withdrawals, and redemptions system-wide.

updateStrategy(address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Restricted to DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE for emergency use only. Normal updates should use requestUpdateStrategy/executeUpdateStrategy.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

depositFromVault(uint256).notice: Deposit from vault with automatic allocation

emergencyWithdrawAll().notice: Emergency withdraw all from all strategies

executeVaultChange().notice: Execute vault change after timelock expires

lastRecordedValue().notice: Last recorded total value (for yield calculation)

peakRecordedValue().notice: High-water mark for totalValue. Used to detect strategy recovery: if currentValue rebounds but stays below peakRecordedValue, it's principal recovery, not yield.

rebalance().notice: Rebalance all strategies to target allocations

recoverToken(address,uint256).notice: Emergency token recovery (not the primary asset)

requestAddStrategy(address,uint256,uint2.notice: Request adding a new strategy (48h timelock)

reserveBps().notice: Reserve buffer in basis points (not deployed to strategies)

targetReserve().notice: Target reserve amount based on total value

totalBacking().notice: Total USDC backing (reserve + deployed to strategies)

totalValue().notice: Total value across reserve + all strategies

totalValueNet().notice: Total value minus accrued protocol fees

vaultChangeRequestTime().notice: Timestamp when vault change was requested

withdraw(address,uint256).notice: Withdraw USDC to a recipient (legacy interface)
